post.description: Starts an export of a survey's responses.

format.description: csv, tsv, spss, json, or ndjson
format.default: csv, tsv, spss, json, or ndjson

startDate.description: Only export responses recorded after the specified date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

endDate.description: Only exports responses recorded before the specified date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

useLabels.description: Instead of exporting the recode value for the answer choice, export the text of the answer choice. For more information on recode values, see [Recode Values](https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/survey-module/question-options/recode-values/).

seenUnansweredRecode.description: Recode seen but unanswered questions with this value.

multiselectSeenUnansweredRecode.description: Recode seen but unanswered choices for multi-select questions. Default is seenUnansweredRecode value.

includeDisplayOrder.description: Include display order information in your export. Useful for surveys with randomization.

formatDecimalAsComma.description: Use a comma as a decimal separator instead of a period.

timeZone.description: Timezone used to determine response date values. See [timezones](doc:time-zones) for more information on time zone format. If this parameter is not provided, dates will be exported in UTC/GMT.

newlineReplacement.description: Configures the newline delimiter for the export. By default, newlines are preserved. Note: this parameter is only relevant for CSV and TSV.

questionIds.description: Export only specified questions (JSON array of Question IDs e.g. ["QID1", "QID3", ... , "QID5"]).

surveyMetadataIds.description: Export only specified survey metadata columns.

compress.description: Export results in an uncompressed format. Note that this is intended for small exports. Large exports may encounter issues downloading large result files. Note it is possible in the future that if an export size is too large uncompressed, that this flag will be ignored and it will be compressed anyway.

exportResponsesInProgress.description: Retrieve the responses in progress only.

get.description: Retrieve the status of a response export

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: Survey ID of export.

parameters.name: exportProgressId
parameters.description: Export progress ID returned by the export creation call.

get.description: Retrieve the response export file after the export is complete

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: Survey ID of the export.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The ID given to you after running your Export Progress call. Note that unlike the legacy v3 export API, the fileId is different from the exportId provided after export creation.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: text/csv; charset=UTF-8

post.description: Starts an import of a CSV or TSV file that is hosted on a public server

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: text/csv; charset=UTF-8

format.description: Allowed values are `CSV` or `TSV`. See guide before for instructions on how to format csv or tsv file.

get.description: Retrieves the status of an import

post.description: Starts an export of a survey's responses. This API is in the process of being deprecated. It will continue to be available; however, for new uses of the API, please see [Create Response Export](ref:create-response-export-new).

format.description: csv, csv2013, xml, json, or spss
format.default: csv, csv2013, xml, json, or spss

surveyId.description: ID of the survey for which to export responses

lastResponseId.description: Export all responses received after the specified response. This parameter will be ignored if you use the startDate parameter.

startDate.description: Only export responses received after the specified date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format. Using this parameter causes the API to ignore lastResponseId.

endDate.description: Only exports responses received before the specified date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

includedQuestionIds.description: Export only specified questions (JSON array of Question IDs e.g. ["QID1", "QID3", ... , "QID5"]). If you would like all of your Embedded Data in your export, you can pass in "embeddedData" into the JSON array (["embeddedData"]). You may also specify specific Embedded Data field names to just export those fields.

useLabels.description: Instead of exporting the recode value for the answer choice, export the text of the answer choice. For more information on recode values, see [Recode Values](https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/survey-module/question-options/recode-values/).

seenUnansweredRecode.description: Recode seen but unanswered questions with this value

useLocalTime.description: Use local timezone to determine response date values. The timezone is set in the admin user interface. See [Managing Your Account](https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/getting-started/managing-your-account/) for more information. If set to **false**, returns time as US Mountain Time (UTC-6:00 or UTC-7:00). Note: when using **spss** format, this parameter is ignored and the response export will use local time.

additionalData.description: A comma separated value field to request additional data in the export. Supported values: DateRecorded

get.description: Retrieve the status of a response export. This API is in the process of being deprecated. It will continue to be available; however, for new uses of the API, please use [Get Response Export Progress](ref:get-response-export-progress-1) in conjunction with [Create Response Export](ref:create-response-export-new).

parameters.name: responseExportId
parameters.description: ID of the response export.

get.description: Retrieve the response export file after the export is complete. This API is in the process of being deprecated. It will continue to be available; however, for new uses of the API, please use [Get Response Export File](ref:get-response-export-file-1) in conjunction with [Create Response Export](ref:create-response-export-new).

parameters.name: responseExportId
parameters.description: The ID given to you after running your Response Export call, i.e., in this {"result":{"id":"ES_joe7s16cjbkfhmi12g0qidmreg"},"meta":{"httpStatus":"200 - OK","requestId":"00ce5254-b020-4c11-8420-41e9f385fb6d"}} it is the second number, 00ce5254-b020-4c11-8420-41e9f385fb6d

post.description: Import responses for a survey from a URL. This API is in the process of being deprecated. It will continue to be available; however, for new uses of the API, please see [Start Response Import By URL](ref:start-import-by-url).

surveyId.description: ID of the survey to import responses into

contentType.description: Content type of the file. Only "text/csv" is currently supported

fileUrl.description: The location of the CSV file containing the responses to be imported, we only support CSV files from ftp, ftps, http, and https

get.description: Retrieve the status of an import. This API is in the process of being deprecated. It will continue to be available; however, for new uses of the API, please use [Get Response Import Progress](ref:get-import-progress) in conjunction with either [Start Response Import](ref:start-import) or [Start Response Import By URL](ref:start-import-by-url).

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: ID of the response import to retrieve

get.description: Get all event subscriptions

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination. The default offset is 0. If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the nextPage parameter in the response.

post.description: Add an event subscription

publicationUrl.description: The fully qualified URL to publish events to. The web server URL must be able to handle HTTP POST. It will be receiving x-www-form-urlencoded data not JSON.

topics.description: String Value of topics to subscribe to. threesixty.* will subscribe to all 360 events from Qualtrics. [More Info](/docs/events)

encrypt.description: If true, will encrypt the event messages using the supplied Shared Key. Encryption will be AES 128 or 256 depending on Shared Key length (16 bytes = 128 bit, 32 bytes = 256 bit). Encryption is not necessary if publishing to an https URL. *	Encrypted MSG is Base64 encoded for transport purposes, therefore you must base64 decode the MSG before decrypting it. MSG plaintext will be in JSON format.

sharedKey.description: If specified, all event messages will be emitted with an HMAC using this key to guarantee message authenticity, and optionally encrypted using this key (if encrypt = true).

get.description: Get an event subscription

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription ID

get.description: Retrieve the contacts in a directory, default pagination size is 100.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional pagination size to determine how many contacts are returned in a single request. Default: **100**, Minimum: **1**, Maximum: **500**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination (Deprecated starting March 1, 2019). The default offset is 0 (i.e. start from the beginning of the directory). If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the **nextPage** parameter in the response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination (will be used starting March 1, 2019). The default offset starts from the beginning of the directory. If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the **nextPage** parameter in the response.

parameters.name: offset

post.description: Retrieve contacts that satisfy conditions you have specified.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as the pool ID

parameters.name: X-API-TOKEN
parameters.description: Your API token

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Optional field which indicate the starting point for the next round of search. The default value is null, i.e. start from the beginning of the directory. If there are additional pages after one request, the skipToken will be added in response.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional page size to determine how many contacts are returned in a single request. The default value is 100, but it can be adjusted from 1 to 100. If you provided a value that violates the minimum or maximum limit, the pageSize will be set to 100.

filter.description: A JSON object that specifies basic filtering criteria. Refer to the documentation below to see how the value for this key is constructed.

If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the **nextPage** parameter in the response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination (will be used starting March 1, 2019). The default offset starts from the beginning of the directory. If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the **nextPage** parameter in the response.

parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: mailinglistId
parameters.description: The ID for the desired mailing list

parameters.name: contactId

get.summary: Get Contact History In Mailing List
get.description: Retrieve the history for contacts in a mailing list, default pagination size is 100.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: mailinglistId
parameters.description: The ID for the desired mailing list

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID for the desired contact

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The desired history type; one of two values: _email_ and _response_

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional pagination size to determine how many contacts are returned in a single request. Default: **100**, Minimum: **1**, Maximum: **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination. The default offset is 0 (i.e. start from the beginning of the directory). If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the **nextPage** parameter in the response.

put.description: Update a single contact in a mailing list

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: mailinglistId
parameters.description: The ID for the desired mailing list

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID for the desired contact

email.description: Contact's email address.  Must be in proper email format.

embeddedData.description: JSON object representing the embedded data fields to set for the contact

language.description: The [language code](/docs/language-codes) to be used for the users account

extRef.description: The external reference for the contact

parameters.name: X-API-TOKEN

get.description: Page through all the transactions for the specified contact

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID of the contact for which transactions will be retrieved

parameters.name: withData
parameters.description: Specifies if the **data** object is returned for each transaction

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies how many transactions to list per page; the minimum is **1**, the maximum is **200**

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: A value that determines the starting point for the next page of transactions

get.description: Retrieve information about a specific transaction. A transaction is additional data that can be embedded into  user's contact.  For example, it could be an actual transaction, like a sales from your sales order system, or information on the customer from Salesforce.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Transaction ID.  Transactions are extra, custom data you can embed into a contact's information.  You can use these in surveys.  For more information look here  https://api.qualtrics.com/docs/using-transactions-in-target-audience

post.description: Append information to a transaction

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The ID of the transaction for which the information will be revised

data.description: The request body consists of one data object (please refer to the documentation below to understand how this object is constructed)

put.description: Revise information about a specific transaction

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The ID of the transaction for which the information will be revised

updatedTransaction.description: The request body consists of one **updatedTransaction** object (please refer to the documentation below to understand how this object is constructed)

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The ID of the transaction to be deleted

post.description: Create transactions for multiple contacts across multiple mailing lists with customized data

transactionId.description: This is not the field name since it is not a JSON key.  So the value put there becomes the key.

transactionDate.description: transaction date in UTC format.  If not given then uses current date and time.  See curl example for format.

data.description: free-form JSON.  So you can make up fields here to use in the survey display logic, etc.  This is not a JSON array.

get.summary: Get Transaction Batches in a Directory
get.description: Page through all the transaction batches in the specified directory.  See the definition of transactions below.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID. Here is information on how to get your Pool ID.  https://api.qualtrics.com/docs/finding-qualtrics-ids

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies how many transaction batches to list per page, the minimum is **1**, the maximum is **200**

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: A value that determines the starting point for the next page of transaction batches

post.description: Create a batch, a collection of transactions

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

transactionIds.description: A JSON array that contains the transactions to include in the batch

creationDate.description: The date formatted as **yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss**. Please see the warning below regarding this parameter.

get.description: Page through all the transactions in the specified batch

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies how many transactions to list per page, the minimum is **1**, the maximum is **200**

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: A value that determines the starting point for the next page of transactions

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: The ID that specifies the batch for which transactions will be retrieved

parameters.name: withDetails
parameters.description: Specifies if the **data** object, **transactionDate**, and **mailingListId** are returned for each transaction

post.description: Add transactions to the specified batch

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: The ID that specifies the batch for which the specified transactions will be added to

transactionIds.description: The request body consists of one or more (limit of 100) transactions listed in a JSON array keyed under **transactionIds**.

get.description: Get all distributions

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The survey ID associated with the distributions

parameters.name: mailingListId
parameters.description: The mailing list or contact group associated with the distribution(s)

parameters.name: distributionRequestType
parameters.description: Specify the type of distribution. Possible values are: Invite, ThankYou, Reminder, Email, Portal, PortalInvite, GeneratedInvite

parameters.name: sendStartDate
parameters.description: Starting range on the distribution send date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

parameters.name: sendEndDate
parameters.description: Ending range on the distribution send date. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination. The default offset is 0. If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the nextPage parameter in the response.

get.description: Gets a distribution

parameters.name: distributionId
parameters.description: Distribution ID

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The survey ID associated with the distribution

parameters.name: distributionId
parameters.description: The Distribution ID

parameters.name: parentDistributionId
parameters.description: Parent Distibution ID

embeddedData.description: Contains up to 10 subkeys. Each of these subkeys has a name, consisting of no more than 200 characters, and a value, consisting of no more than 1024 characters.

parameters.name: parentDistributionId
parameters.description: Parent Distibution ID

sendDate.description: Time to send the distribution. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

embeddedData.description: Contains up to 10 subkeys. Each of these subkeys has a name, consisting of no more than 200 characters, and a value, consisting of no more than 1024 characters.

post.description: Create a new survey distribution via SMS

sendDate.description: Time to send the SMS. See [Dates and Times](doc:dates-and-times) for more information on the date and time format.

method.description: Determines how the survey will be sent out via SMS.  Can be either **Invite**, **Interactive**, **Reminder** or **Thankyou**.  Interactive means the questions are presented to the user one at a time in an interactive ping-pong type interactive-type session.

surveyId.description: ID of the survey to distribute to recipients

mailingListId.description: Mailing List ID for a batch distribution - Required for Invite and Interactive method. Cannot be provided for **Reminder** and **Thankyou**

contactId.description: Contact ID for an individual distribution. Cannot be provided for **Reminder** and **Thankyou**

parentDistributionId.description: ID of the distribution to send a **Reminder** or **Thankyou** distribution. Can be used only with these two methods.

messageId.description: ID of the message. The **messageId** is required in conjunction with the **libraryId** if no **messageText** is supplied. A message object is only required with the **Invite**, **Reminder**, and **Thankyou** methods.

libraryId.description: Library ID of the message. libraryId is required in conjunction with the messageId if no messageText is supplied. A message object is only required by "Invite" method.

messageText.description: Custom message text. Either **messageText** or **messageId** must be provided but not both. A message object is only required with the **Invite**, **Reminder**, and **Thankyou** methods.

get.description: Get all sms distributions for a survey

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The survey ID associated with the sms distributions

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset for the pagination. The default offset is 0. If there are additional pages, the offset value for the next page will be appended to the value of the nextPage parameter in the response.

get.description: Retrieve a list of individual distribution links for an existing distribution, for unsubscribed contacts in specified mailing list, the link will be null. Refer to the documentation below for further information regarding usage of this API's result.

parameters.name: distributionId
parameters.description: The ID returned from [Generate Distribution Links](doc:generate-distribution-invite)

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The ID of the survey that the distribution belongs to

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: The pagination token to retrieve next page of distribution links. Default to empty for the first page. The fixed page size is 100.

post.summary: Import Contacts into Mailing List with Transactions
post.description: Import contacts into the specified mailing list - contacts can have associated transaction data

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as the pool ID

parameters.name: mailingListId
parameters.description: The mailing list ID that the contacts should be imported into

transactionMeta.description: A JSON object that specifies details regarding the per contact transactional data. Refer to the [documentation](doc:import-mailing-list-contacts-with-transactions#transactionmeta) below to see how this object is constructed. (optional)

contacts.description: A JSON array of JSON objects, where each object represents information about a contact. Refer to the [documentation](doc:import-mailing-list-contacts-with-transactions#contacts) below to see how this object is constructed.

get.description: Retrieve the status of the associated import request

get.description: Page through all the tickets in an organization

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start position for pagination, **minimum** is **0**

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of tickets to return per page, **maximum** is **50**

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: The owner of the ticket, must match the pattern, **^UR_[0-9a-zA-Z]{11,15}$**

parameters.name: ticketStatus
parameters.description: The status of a ticket, **minimum** is **0**

parameters.name: X-API-TOKEN
parameters.description: Your Qualtrics API token

post.description: Creates a contact-frequency rule. Please note that you can only have a maximum of 20 rules.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

targetType.description: The targetType for this rule. Must be ONE of the following: Directory, MailingList, Survey

targetIds.description: The ids of the target. For mailing lists, this will be mailing list ids, for directories this will be directoryId, for surveys this will be surveyId

emailType.description: The types of email the rule applies to. Valid values are: Invite or Email. Email is for any email message, including Invites.

daysBetween.description: The days between invites or emails.

timePeriodLimit.description: Defines the maximum number of messages a contact can receive in a given time period. This is a object with two fields: period, numMessages. numMessages is an integer and period can be Day, Week, or Month

alwaysSend.description: Turns on alwaysSend. If turned on, when this ContactFrequency rule conflicts with another ContactFrequency rule, this distribution will ignore the conflict and send the distribution.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The contact frequency Rule ID

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The contact frequency Rule ID

targetType.description: The targetType for this rule. Must be ONE of the following: Directory, MailingList, Survey

targetIds.description: The ids of the target. For mailing lists, this will be mailing list ids, for directories this will be directoryId, for surveys this will be surveyId

emailType.description: The types of email the rule applies to. Valid values are: Invite or Email. Email is for any email message, including Invites.

daysBetween.description: The days between invites or emails.

timePeriodLimit.description: Defines the maximum number of messages a contact can receive in a given time period. This is a object with two fields: period, numMessages. numMessages is an integer and period can be Day, Week, or Month

alwaysSend.description: Turns on alwaysSend. If turned on, when this ContactFrequency rule conflicts with another ContactFrequency rule, this distribution will ignore the conflict and send the distribution.

parameters.name: directoryId
parameters.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The contact frequency Rule ID

get.description: Gets a list of all activity type logging events

parameters.name: activityType
parameters.description: The type of audit event you want the logs for

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: The brand you want to search

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user you want to search

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return per request

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Determines how the events are organized, can be: asc or desc

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: The next page token value returned by a previous call

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the log event

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date of the log event

post.description: Create a new erasure request

emails.description: List of customer emails to be deleted.

searchOnly.description: Do a dry run of the request. Does not do any deletion of entities

get.description: Get all Erasure Requests for a brand
Get a single Erasure Request

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: ID of the erasure request

requestId.title: requestId
requestId.description: An identifier for the incoming request.

requestId.title: requestId
requestId.description: An identifier for the incoming request.

responseId.title: responseId
responseId.description: The unique ID for each response

values.title: values
values.description: `values` is a set of key-value pairs corresponding to question-answer pairs. There can also be key-value pairs representing meta data for the response such as `startDate` or `userLanguage`.

distributionChannel.title: distributionChannel
distributionChannel.description: The method by which the survey was distributed to respondents

duration.title: duration
duration.description: How long it took for the respondent to finish the survey in seconds

endDate.title: endDate
endDate.description: The point in time when the survey response was finished

finished.title: finished
finished.description: If the respondent finished and submitted the survey, the value will be 1, otherwise it will be 0

locationLatitude.title: locationLatitude
locationLatitude.description: The approximate location of the respondent at the time the survey was taken

locationLongitude.title: locationLongitude
locationLongitude.description: The approximate location of the respondent at the time the survey was taken

progress.title: progress
progress.description: How far the respondent has progressed through the survey as a percentage

recordedDate.title: recordedDate
recordedDate.description: The point in time when the survey response was recorded

startDate.title: startDate
startDate.description: The point in time when the survey response was started

labels.title: labels
labels.description: `labels` is a set of key-value pairs where each key corresponds to a key in the `values` object and the value is the label of the answer of that question.

NotYetAvailableResponse.title: Retrieve Response Response - Not Yet Available

message.title: Message
message.description: The Survey Response is not yet available. Please try again later.

result.message: The Survey Response is not yet available. Please try again later.

idempotencyKey.name: Idempotency-Key
idempotencyKey.description: In order to make a request to create a survey response idempotent, pass a UUID in this header. Repeated requests with the same Idempotency Key will not create duplicates.

decrementQuotas.name: decrementQuotas
decrementQuotas.description: If true, any relevant quotas will be decremented.

Since.description: The date from which to begin searching for contacts
Since.title: Since

PageSize.description: The maximum number of contacts to return per request
PageSize.title: PageSize

DirectoryId.description: The directory ID, also known as a pool ID
DirectoryId.title: DirectoryId

MailingListId.description: The ID for the desired mailing list
MailingListId.title: MailingListId

DirectoryContactCount.title: DirectoryContactCount
DirectoryContactCount.description: An approximate count of the contacts in the directory.

api_token.description: This is a schema for x-api-token header authentication.
api_token.name: X-API-TOKEN

public_oauth2.description: This is a schema for a public oauth2 api.
